intro: Helicteres sundaica, commonly known as the Sunda hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with red veins, which bloom during the rainy season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
